job_title: Faculty Member in Coon Rapids, MN
pros: Great faculty support. People love what they do.
cons: Not a lot of food options. No dedicated faculty parking.

job_title: Peer Tutor, Virtual in Cambridge, MN
pros: Flexible, accomodating, friendly, great workplace environment, listens to feedback
cons: Only current students can work as peer tutors

job_title: Peer Tutor in Coon Rapids, MN
pros: Ability to work with students and help them understand their material enforcing your knowledge as well.
cons: Some students were difficult to work with, which is typical.

review_title: A great place for community and education.
job_title: Peer Tutor in Coon Rapids, MN
pros: A place with a wonderful community and environment.  Great cost for quality education. Smaller classes sizes you can get to know professors on a personal level and ask questions.
cons: I have seen very few con's to ARCC. It is hard to transition to a large University when the community you are used to and grown so close to goes.

review_title: OK Pay, Challenging Students, Useless Administrators
job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Pay is better than many similar jobs I've seen.  Facilities are adequate.
cons: Student turnover rate is high, and many students are ill-prepared for college-level subject matter.

review_title: Family atmosphere in most cases but some departments have issues
pros: Beautiful campus, well managed business department. The college has planned well for current economic situation. Facilities and technology departments are great to work with
cons: State agency so there is little opportunity for advancement but managment does what it can but this can be seen as unfair to some

pros: Supportive leadership, diverse students, opportunities for professional development, good colleagues
cons: They are trying to address this, but there is a lack of diversity among faculty.

job_title: Director of Development in Coon Rapids, MN
pros: Good employees, support the mission, helpful.  Great chance to help students and the community.
cons: Administration uses short-term thinking and expects long-term returns.

job_title: Chief Marketing & Communications Officer in Coon Rapids, MN
pros: Employees have the ability to positively impact students' lives every day.
cons: Budgets can be tight when the legislature restricts funding for higher education.

pros: good environment to work in. receive help from fellow employees.
cons: It was difficult working and going to school at the same time

pros:

pros: Great community and support. Able to do my own hw during slow times.
cons: Low pay and semester based employment for peer tutors

job_title: Full-time Unlimited Mathematics Instructor in Iowa City, IA
pros: Small School. Some faculty worth learning from.
cons: Had to commute between the Coon Rapids campus and Cambridge campus. Instructors more concerned about being friends with students than teaching. Instructors refuse to change and adapt unless they get something out of it. High turnover of administration

job_title: Student Worker in Coon Rapids, MN
pros: Great place to start for students to build credit
cons: Nothing to say anything bad about

pros: Free college tuition and campus atmosphere

cons: They do not care about you as a person. They care about money and not meeting student needs.
